title: Goldman teams up with MSCI and Coin Metrics for digital asset classification and benchmarks; Goldman is working with MSCI on benchmarks and Coin Metrics for market data on a wide universe of digital currency specialists
text:
Goldman Sachs Group Inc. GS, MSCI and Coin Metrics have teamed up to form Datonomy a new data service offering a framework for classifying and tracking the performance of digital assets for portfolio construction and other investing tools.

Goldman is providing its technology backbone while MSCI is contributing its prowess in indexing. Coin Metrics is supplying market data from the crypto world.

"It's quite easy to put thing into a spread sheet — the hard part is making something you can use to actually provide a way to analyze the market," Goldman executive Andrew Phillips told MarketWatch.

Volatility in the crypto market — including the instability in recent days with the plight of crypto broker FTX — creates a further need for performance tracking ad risk management in digital asset markets, the companies said.

"A lot of people, when they talk about digital assets, they think of bitcoin BTCUSD and ethereum ETHE," Phillips said. "What's interesting is there's a fairly diverse ecosystem of people doing different things in the digital asset space."

Datonomy breaks the digital currency universe into four major classes: digital currencies, blockchain infrastructure, digital asset applications and on-chain derivatives.

Within each of those classes, it currently lists 14 sectors and 41 subsectors.

Within the digital currency class, for example, the two sectors are value transfer coins and specialized coins and the subsectors within them include value transfer coins, meme coins, privacy coins and remittance coins.

Within digital assets applications, Datonomy offers looks at six sectors including decentralized finance, which has eight corresponding subsectors: decentralized exchanges, derivatives trading, decentralized lending, stablecoin issuers, prediction markets, asset management, crowdfunding and insurance.

The metaverse is listed as one of the other sectors within digital asset applications. The subsectors in the metaverse include virtual worlds, gaming and NFT ecosystems.

Phillips, who is global head of marquee product strategy for Goldman Sachs, said the Datonomy product will help Goldman Sachs's bottom line by providing more services that institutional clients want.

"Our core business is helping our clients in markets," he said. "This is a new market and we're being thoughtful on how we approach it," adding, "We're thinking about how this evolves over time and what we can apply to it technology-wise."

Coin Metrics CEO Tim Rice said Datonomy marks a "significant leap" for the industry by "establishing a coherent and future-proof structure to monitor and analyze the digital asset ecosystem," according to a statement.

Stéphane Mattatia, managing director at MSCI, said, "a consistent and standardized framework for the classification of digital assets is essential to support investors' ability to evaluate the market."

Goldman teams up with MSCI and Coin Metrics for digital asset classification and benchmarks
